task: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

plan.reasoning: Activate asammdf window
Discover available UI elements before interacting
Open the Mode menu to switch to Batch processing (KB shows Mode → Batch processing)
Capture the Mode menu contents to locate the 'Batch processing' option
Switch application to Batch processing mode as required for concatenation
Confirm Batch processing view is active and discover batch controls (file list, operations)
Open File menu as a fallback to add input files when an 'Add files' button may not be present (KB open_files)
Capture File menu contents to select the Open command
Open the file dialog to select multiple .MF4 files (use File → Open as KB fallback)
Capture the Open dialog elements (filename edit field) to input path/wildcard
Select all .MF4 files in the target folder using a wildcard in the file dialog to add them to the batch (KB open_files)
Confirm the files were added to the Batch processing list
Select the 'Concatenate' operation for the batch of files (KB describes selecting Concatenate in Batch processing)
Locate output filename field and optional sync option in the batch operation panel
Enable 'Sync using measurement timestamps' to align measurements across files if that option is present (optional step from KB)
Enter the output filename and full path for the concatenated MF4 (KB instructs entering output filename in batch operation)
Start the concatenation operation and save results to the specified output file (KB: click Start/Save)
Wait for the concatenation to complete; adjust duration depending on file sizes
Verify that Batch processing completed successfully and/or that the output file is present

Switch to Batch processing mode, add all .MF4 files from the specified folder via File→Open (fallback for missing 'Add files' button), select Concatenate operation, set output path to the requested filename in the same folder, and start the operation. State captures are used before each interaction to avoid previously observed failures when elements were missing.
